poem:
**Green Wheels**

In every teenage pocket, unlock keys,  
wheels spinning freedom beneath wise feet,  
each pedal stroke a note in city symphony.  
Gently coaxing tangled thoughts into rhythm,  
harmony found in rubber and road.  
Pavements clear, hearts unlocked,  
they ride to fast food dreams  
along lime-lit streets.  
No beeps, no stray wheels,  
just the sound of summer turning.
